samples.context: Though these animals lay hundreds of eggs and release millions of sperms, all the eggs do not get fertilised and develop into new individuals.
samples.question: Why do not all eggs get fertilised?

samples.context: This is because the eggs and sperms get exposed to water movement, wind and rainfall.
samples.question: What factors affect egg fertilisation?

samples.context: Production of large number of eggs and sperms is necessary to ensure fertilisation of at least a few of them.
samples.question: Why is large egg production important?

samples.context: Also, there are other animals in the pond which may feed on eggs.
samples.question: What risks do eggs face in their environment?

samples.context: Though these animals lay hundreds of eggs and release millions of sperms, not all eggs develop into new individuals.
samples.question: What happens to the majority of released eggs?
